title: Effects of 8000 dollar deposit at JCM Bank

content.description:
Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes. If the question prompts you to “Calculate,” you must show how you arrived at your final answer.

Respond to all parts of the question.

Simon opens a new checking account and deposits <math overflow="scroll"> <mstyle mathvariant="normal"> <mrow> <mtext>$8,000</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> in cash in <math overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>JCM</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> Bank. The required reserve ratio is <math overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent.

(a) Draw a correctly labeled balance sheet (<math overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>T</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>-account) for <math overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>JCM</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> Bank and show the numerical value of each of the following as a result of this deposit before any loans have been made.

(i) Change in Required Reserves (<math overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>RR</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>)

(ii) Change in Excess Reserves (<math overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>ER</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>)

(iii) Change in Demand Deposits (<math overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>DD</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>)

(b) What is the maximum amount of loans that <math overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>JCM</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> Bank can initially make from Simon’s deposit? Provide a numerical value.

(c) As a result of Simon’s deposit, calculate the maximum amount by which the money supply will increase throughout the banking system. Show your work.

(d) In general, how will an increase in the money supply affect unemployment in the short run? Explain.
